Pravda - sequent calculus

On this page, you will learn about sequent calculus. Just like in natural deduction, you manipulate sequents, but now there can be more than one formula on the right-hand side. For instance p, q |- q, r is a sequent, composed of:
  • On the left-hand side, a list of hypotheses (here p, q)
  • On the right-hand side, a list of possible conclusions (here q, r)
  • The symbol |- in the middle separates the hypotheses from the possible conclusions.
Intuitively, Gamma |- Delta means that you can prove one of the formulas in Delta, based on the hypotheses in Gamma. The set Gamma can be empty, meaning you can prove one of the formulas in Delta without any hypotheses, as well as Delta which would mean the hypotheses in Gamma can prove false.

In propositional logic
